Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty and neglected!”
Reviews.Author: KateDVista
Reviews.Content: My friend Celeste had a really early flight and as she has some physical disabilities, we decided to get a room close to the airport the night before her flight as I live about 50 miles from the airport. The parking lot was very tiny and tucked away around the corner so that was my first worry. The lobby was clean and bright and the young man that assisted us was very friendly and willing to accommodate when we asked for a smoking room (ok I know! ) After a ride in a tiny elevator we found , our room was at the end of the hall, right next to a fire escape door that was propped open.This building is very old and I think was a studio apartment house in it's younger days. Building materials were propped against the walls in the hallway and it smelled musty and slightly of curry. In our room large cracks adorned the walls, paint was peeling from the door frames,there was no phone, the heater was right against one of the beds, slats broken and didn't work on the heat setting. The carpet was old and dirty. The bathroom was ancient, cracked tiles and the toilet was up on a raised platform. There was a little kitchenette but the light didn't work. It didn't seem too clean, but there was a working fridge and two microwaves. I went to the lobby to ask for an ashtray and was told that you couldn't smoke in the building because it would smell up the hallways,but out on the fire escape, which is why I guess that door was propped open. This led me to feel unsafe as anyone could come up the fire escape stairs and into the building virtually unseen. I worried about bed bugs, the mattress were very hard and the pillows flat.I took pictures on my cell phone but need to get a cord to download them to my computer. Will try and do so soon.We paid $102. for this room and it was NOT a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Grape Street!!”
Reviews.Author: artglink
Reviews.Content: Due to overbooking at Marriott Mariana, travel agent booked me here since all SD hotels were booked except here[ should have been warning] Charged $325 per night, I was booked for 3. My gut told me not to check in but it was late and clerk was friendly and it was late. Upon walking down hall to room encountered smelly dirty mattress propped against wall, dozens of dirty old TV's lined the hallway, stained carpet, peeling paint, missing door trim and musty, smelly air hit me. The room- Smelled of a dirty bathroom, dirty windows, sticky doors, bathroom dirty floor and toilet no toilet paper [broken holder] BUGS in tub!! But greatest fear was door sticky and OPEN door to balcony off of hallway made me feel insecure, especially traveling alone. Wish I had a camera!! I called Amex Travel to GET ME OUT OF HERE!! Had talked to clerk about problem of smell he said "I come check in morning" Never put my luggage in room, fear of bugs! Was fortunate to find a clean room at Holiday Inn Express down the street! Hotel refused to give me a refund, saying they were full and couldn't resell my room [ they lied, had vacancies and listed them the next morning at $400 per night!!! HOW can this place get a certificate of health and be on any travel co,s list??? What a shame because with the location and proper management this could be charming, but not a $325!! The Marriott at the Marina where I stayed prior to this was $109 Great room, service, location and worth it if I paid $325!!! Lesson learned READ reviews,!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS......LOTS OF PAIN...(CHINCHES EN ESPANOL)”
Reviews.Author: HernanAnaheim
Reviews.Content: II rent room 405 with my family last saturday 14 feb 2012...i was eaten and bitten by the bed bugs...ended my weekend in a medical facility with allergic reaction to the bed insects...who ever speak spanish..."chinches"....Please be carefull this situation is dangerous and the manager....Jay do not take any action to solve the problem......and denies the facts......I am tryng to find reimbursement for my medical expenses and there is no response so far...Please dont go to harborview inn...dont take the risk to take this insects to your home.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget stay”
Reviews.Author: joseyong1986
Reviews.Content: I looked at all the reviews only AFTER my stay, because I hadn't booked a place before reaching San Diego at 8pm and went hostel hunting around Little Italy for a place to stay the night. I found Harborview Inn & Suites and liked it so much that I eventually extended my stay for 2 more nights. So I'm quite surprised at the negative reactions, but it could be a matter of expectations. Personally though, for the price I paid, I think I got a steal. Everything was in working order - air-conditioning, shower, TV - and the beds were comfortable. The location was fantastic - a 15 minute walk from the harbour. Internet wi-fi was good and consistent too, which is something that many other accommodations lack. If you're on a trip to explore, maximise your budget and not waste time lounging around in your hotel room, then Harborview Inn & Suites is highly recommended, based on my experiences at least.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: april_honeybee
Reviews.Content: Our family was on our way to San Diego on a road trip. Instead of stopping along the way, we decided to drive all the way down last minute. After being in the car for 10 hours with two young children we found out that our original hotel the Hyatt Regency Mission Bay was completely booked that night. I tried calling all the other hotels in the area but they were all completely booked for the night also. So, I decided to call hotels.com and ask for some help in searching for a hotel for my family just for one night before we check into the Hyatt the next day. The lady on the phone told us that she found a "great hotel" for us in downtown San Diego with a view of the harbor and it's luckily the same cost as the Hyatt. It sounded good on the phone and I put my trust in her to help my family out because we were all exhausted from the road trip. After I got off the phone with her I checked the hotel on trip adviser and found out it was not a good fit for our family. I called hotels.com back and they would not allow us to change hotels. We had no other choice but to go to the hotel and check in. The front desk lady looked at me crazy when I asked for a room with a king instead of one queen. She said, "WE HAVE NO KINGS HERE!", like it was a stupid question. My family of 4 piled into this "suite" with one queen and a smelly old sofa bed and I wanted to cry. It had a nasty dingy smell and the carpet was wet in the living area of the room. It was really gross and I couldn't wait to leave the next day. I was told by hotels.com that it had a view of the harbor and we only had a view of the parking lot. In fact, I don't think any of the rooms had a view at all. We heard cars honking and airplanes flying over us all night. My two little girls had a really hard time sleeping. I can't believe hotels.com took advantage of us like that. I'll never use them again. This room was the same price as the Hyatt? That is criminal!

Reviews.Title: “Cancelling...THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!! LILA was very unprofessional or unhelpful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buttons1229
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation online on 29 June for arriving 1 July and didn't see where they had the cancellation policy saying you had to call 3 days prior to cancel. First of all that is along time prior to have to cancel. Life happens and things change. Lila took my number and was going to call me back. She never did. After a few hours I called back and she still said that I was going to be charged for one night. I didn't agree with that since I didn't have 3 days to cancel. She wasn't willing to help and not very supportive. I asked to speak to a manager and she said she was the manager for the day. i asked for the General manager. She kept saying there wasn't one....then she said there was nobody there today and then she was saying they might not be there for a couple of days. She didn't have a straight fwd story and wouldn't give me the Managers name. I work at a Hotel and that is a big NO NO!!! You can't refuse to give out the managers name. I wouldn't recommend this place to ANYBODY!!! She was not helpful at all!!! Do yourself a favor and don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, smelly room....terrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cruisergirl2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire. There are only two positive things about the hotel. One is the location, couldn't complain about that other than the street was very noisy and the planes fly directly overhead (and I mean to the point where you feel they are going to land on your room) until well after midnight. Other than that, it is close to excellent places to eat, transportation, freeway and the harbour. The other was aside from the up charging that the hotel staff does, they were very accommodating and friendly and as helpful as they were able to be. The hotel smelled and was old and uncared for. The room was disgusting. I asked for a non smoking and got one that had been covered up with highly allergenic air freshner. There was mould in the fridge, old food in the drawers, cracked walls, cracked casing that had come off and was just banged into place again. The kitchenette had a sink and fridge, no cutlery or dishes and the sink was completely corroded. The windows didn't close properly, likely original ones. The bathroom was old, fixtures were chipped, towels frayed, no kleenex, the cheapest soap I have ever seen. Beds were ok, no bed bugs or cockroaches but when I stripped off the sheets to check the mattresses, there were old blood stains on the mattress cover. Breakfast was a joke, coffee with creamer, toast, frozen waffles. Might as well lower the rate and not have breakfast. Everything was an up charge, with a "resort" fee (of course there was no resort) and extra for another bed. When my friends and family called the staff was indifferent and never offered to take a message. There was no voicemail so that wasn't an option either. All in all a dismal experience for what Hotwire rates as a 2 star hotel. I would maybe give them a 1 star for location. Sad because the hotel has tons of potential with some of the original finishes and could be a gem in a fantastic location. The grande dame has let herself go!! I would not recommend this hotel to any but the most indifferent or adventurous people who don't care where they lay their head down to sleep! Sadly, it wasn't even cheap at all, I would have used the up charges to book a better hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LAmoondreamer
Reviews.Content: After reading the terrible reviews for this hotel, I wasn't expecting much in the way of accommodations; but I just needed a conveniently located place to stay for one night....so I took a chance. It greatly exceeded my expectations! The regular rooms are quite small, but adequate; and, since 3 of us were traveling together, we were given adjoining rooms. One of the rooms had a large sitting room included (for no extra charge), so we would have a place to sit and talk. This room had a nice sized refrigerator and a small microwave. The bathrooms looked newly redone, and were very clean. They must've replaced the inferior towels, because the ones in my bathroom were thick and soft. There were no musty or bad smells in the hall or the rooms. The airport's close and it's a noisy, downtown location, but that's the price you pay for convenience. Just bring earplugs! The staff was friendly and very helpful. I'd recommend a stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing says welcome to a hotel like a dead lamp abandoned in the hallway.”
Reviews.Author: siouxbdoo
Reviews.Content: Free parking (good). Checked into the hotel - was not asked for ID or credit card for incidentals (didn't realize at that time that there were NO incidentals). I believe we had the best room in the house. Back side of hotel is some kind of weekly/monthly rental property - pretty seedy guests hanging around smoking on steps. Opened door to our room and was met with terrible air freshener smell, apparently used to cover up smoke smell. Opened windows, which remained open the entire weekend. Grape Street is loud at night, but noise was preferable to bad smell. Amenities were of poor quality - bar soap and "conditioning shampoo." Advertised continental breakfast was frozen waffles, bread and a toaster. Coffee was available in the morning on Saturday, but not on Sunday. When we went to check out, front desk clerk was outside smoking. He said we should just leave our key cards on the counter. There's no real reason to ask anyone how was their stay - everyone knows the answer is "NOT GOOD."

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wassilo33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comparable to any Super 8/ Econo Lodge I have patroned. The room was actually quite large with a fridge/microwave/t.v. and internet. The room itself was clean and basic and the bathroom clean. No evidence of cockroaches as previous reviews stated. My only recommendation would be to invest in better pillows/towels. They were very flat. The staff was very accomodating to any requests to make my stay enjoyable and appreciated the little extras. As a Canadian from Edmonton, Alberta, it was a pleasure to be treated so nicely. The location was perfect with in a 20-25 min walk to downtown/gaslamp/ and hillcrest. Little Italy and the harbour are only only 3-5 minute walk. Excellent trolley system nearby for the lazy people that won't just walk. You can get anywhere from here and am so happy I did not stay at Hotel circle area for the same price. Biggest complaint: The location is very noisy being next to a freeway and main road of Grape St.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Eventer3day
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel and had an excellent experience. The staff were responsive (family owned) and extremely friendly. They were always very accommodating to our needs no matter what the hour was. We missed not having a coffeemaker in the room but they made us coffee whenever we wanted it. Perfect location for the convention center and the airport. Rooms a bit dated but bathrooms were great! If you are looking for a great bargain on a budget hotel in a nice area....STAY HERE! Quick walk to EXCELLENT affordable dining - 5 mins walk to the harbor - close to public transportation - short cab ride around to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “SCARY”
Reviews.Author: Morgan92154
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at Harborview on November 20, 2010 for one night. I attempted to check in twice, the second time was about 3:30 PM, both times no rooms were available as none had been cleaned. The second time I attempted to check in, I was asked to pay an additional $10.00 fee, which was never explained to me. I told the man at the counter that I had already paid my hotel through Southwest and told him that I did not think that an additional fee was part of the deal. When asking about the fee, the man at the counter became angry, began shouting at me, was verbally abusive. I told the man to stop shouting at me, at which time, he continued his tirade. I asked to speak to the manager, who the front counter man called. The "manager" was a woman, would not explain the $10.00 fee. I asked for my credit card back, at which time the man at the counter SLAMMED my credit card on the counter in front of me while still in a verbal tirade. I then exited the lobby and called Southwest Airlines who booked the room. Southwest credited back my room charge and made other arrangements for me. I went back into the front counter and asked for my registration slip, as my personal information was on the slip. I took the slip and left the hotel. The man at the front counter followed me out of the hotel and began following me up the street toward their parking lot, shouting at me, demanding I pay the $10.00. I had to tell the man not to come any closer to me. I went to my car, began driving out of the hotel driveway. The man from the front counter was still standing on the sidewalk in front of the hotel shouting at me. Apparently the hotel is trying to extort extra money from customers, that is the only explanation for the request that I could come up with. WOW Almost had to call the Police for help !!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, would recommend to the budget concious”
Reviews.Author: hendoo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice in a month's time with friends. Loved the location, just 2 blocks from San Diego's Little Italy and some of the best eating in southern California, and very close to the airport, Maritime Museum, and trolley. Price was very reasonable. Free parking. Clean. Felt safe. Had some quirks but for the price, we dealt nicely with them. Owner very accommodating and extremely helpful. Would describe as an older boutique hotel. Have certainly stayed in much worse for many more dollars in San Francisco for example. Rooms we stayed in were fairly large with microwave and small refrig. It's not the Ritz, but would recommend to anyone traveling on a budget. Another plus for us, they accepted pets at a reasonable fee. Hear they are opening a B&B across the street too.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get any sleep this night!!!”
Reviews.Author: chgrfn
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this place. It has a foul order, alarms going off all night long and is invested with cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and rude service!”
Reviews.Author: c_floyd066
Reviews.Content: Spent one horrid night there in August 2010. Cockroaches in the room and the office personnel had the audacity to deny it and called us liars!!! Do NOT give them a nickel of your hard earned money!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even bother with this place.”
Reviews.Author: TeamQ2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to extend our honeymoon after staying at the Elsbree House in Ocean Beach. We read all kinds of great reviews about this place; it was close to Downtown San Diego, somewhat close to Coronado, and they were very reasonable. (150 for two nights!). Well, you get what you pay for. The rooms were not horrible. However, when we opened the door, the room smelled musty. As soon as we turned on the air, we smelled mildew. I was having asthma problems and we decided this was not the place to be. On top of that, the customer service was poor (I had to call several times and leave a message with a 'manager' who never returned my call) and questionable. Also, we got a partial refund--they charged us for the more expensive day. There is a cute Little Italy Inn right across the street from this place; I would highly recommend looking there instead. Also, be wary of the website; it is very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for downtown”
Reviews.Author: smatx6
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great price and location if you want to be within walking distance to restaurants/bars -- Little Italy is only a couple of blocks away. 7-11 is only a block away. The freeway access is right there too so that was convenient. Internet connection is free, although there was a period when it wasn't working. It was fixed though after I informed the front desk. CONS: Building is a little run-down. The parking lot is small and cramped -- there's no room to turn around so you have to reverse all the way out. The room was tiny and there wasn't much space to move around. The refrigerator wasn't working. The bed light would often make buzzing and high-pitched noises which could get annoying. Structure isn't good so sometimes you can hear people next door, in the hallway, and above you. I would say this hotel is ok for short stays and singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the other reviews led me to believe.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel room using Hotwire, so I did not have a chance to look at the reviews beforehand. Upon reading the reviews I was a bit concerned. However, it lowered my expectations such that when I got there, I was pleasantly surprised. This is a budget operation. I woke up the desk attendant to check in (2 AM), but, while dreary eyed, he was amply pleasant. As you might pick up from the other reviews, the hotel could use a renovation to make the hall a bit less dim, but the carpets were fine enough and clean. The room was actually rather large, clean, and comfortable. Yes, the towels are rather small and not fluffy at all, but still acceptable. Breakfast is sliced muffins, orange juice, fruit and coffee. Nothing special, but enough to get you on your way. The dreary eyed manager was pleasant and helpful. In the end, the stay turned out to be more than adequate, and better than the more negative reviews would lead you to expect. I would not avoid this hotel, and it can be a bargain. When talking to the guy at the desk, he recommended calling to get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great location”
Reviews.Author: scplz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harborview with a girlfriend. Our room was a good size. Had a safe, 2 TV's one was a big flatscreen. Free Wifi and parking was a bonus. Bathroom was very clean. As stated in other reviews the towels are incredibly small and flimsey, bring your own. The hallways were a little dingey but that was not a big deal for me. No issues with the staff as mentioned in previous reviews. They were pretty helpfull with directions and suggestions. What I really like about this hotel was that it was close to basically eveything good downtown. Short and cheap cab ride if you're heading to the gaslamp tonight. Luxurious hotel.......not at all. But for the price and location its awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bextar611
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were taking a long weekend to San Diego. We were trying to choose a hotel by balancing economical rates with a location close to a variety of restaurants and bars. I read some of these reviews and was a little nervous about choosing this one. However, the room was small but clean and the hotel staff was very accommodating. The bathroom was new and there was a big screen tv in the room. I think if you are expecting a Hilton, then book a Hilton. The reason I would book this again is because I don't like to stay in my room all day. I like being able to walk to restaurants and bars. The trolley is close and parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: djaitin
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at the Harborview inn, San Diego California. The intention was to take a cheap place to stay for us, thinking that we only need to sleep there. What a mistake! We should have read this site reviews on this inn before going for it. The few reviews that recommend this place were surely wrote by the inn's owner's relatives/friends/themselves. One reviewer ended his/her report stating that somebody should be reported to some authority, and I completely agree. This is not a two star place to stay, no way. Where to start? The inn is dirty, worn out (its site reads "remodeled", give me a break), rooms so small, that the relatively cheap price turns our expensive. Towels are always two, very small and thin. If you ask the lady that owns the business, the one at the front desk, for more towels, she automatically smiles and asks for money for extra people, even though we already paid for the two queen beds room. Next, rooms have cigarette odors. In the morning, if you go to the kind of lobby, you find coffee instead of the "continental breakfast" they claim to give. The funny lady notices you and runs to the kitchen to cut cheap chocolate cupcakes, which we haven't tried but looked old, on a dirty tray. No, thanks. Many more... Our stay in this place obscured an otherwise great time we always have in San Diego, our favorite city for vacations. Bottom line, next time I'll spend a few more bucks and get a real two star motel/hotel, as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: keyair
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for no frills and a great location then this is the place for you. The price was right and they offered parking for no additional charge. It is in little italy and 1/2 mile from the gaslamp district and the water! We thought the couple that ran and/or owned the hotel was very nice and they let us lock up our bikes in a storage area so we didn't have to take them upstairs. The room was very clean, but very small. We would definitely stay here again, but maybe upgrade to a suite instead of a queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience of my LIFE!!!”
Reviews.Author: yolanda187
Reviews.Content: BAD BAD BAD!!! The lady at the front was TERRIBLE!!! The hotel itself (if you even want to call it that..) was run down and poorly kept. I have never IN MY LIFE been treated so badly! This woman overcharged me, threatened to kick us out for no logical reason and even had her husband yelling at us about the WAR!! Seriously??? This place needs to be shut down ASAP! And... the next day she was so nice to us, pretending like nothing ever happened. This place is worth a penny a night, they know nothing about customer service, and I can honestly say I want to STOP anyone from ever going there AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: LovingSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, Friendly desk clerk, Room was clean and comfortable with a view of the harbor, bed was comfortable, nice flat screen t.v with small fridge and microwave. Free Wi-Fi as well was great. Close to freeway. Parking is ok. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: travelindave45454
Reviews.Content: Oh my. The Harborview Inn and Suites in San Diego is horrible. First off, there is no view of the harbor. You either have a nice freeway view or a brick wall. Well, they were remodeling this hotel and the place was a wreck. She stuck us in a crappy room upstairs, and luckily we didn't spend much time in it, as we wanted to party. Our friends laughed at us when they picked us up. We all wondered how this place was even open. For night two, we were moved, and she put us in the absolute worst room I've ever seen--somewhere between the storage garage and maid closet. 6 pm still no maid service, though they only have 40 crappy rooms. It looked like we booked a room in Iraq. In a hotel that was first bombed, then taken over by the homeless. She refused to reimburse us and was actually quite rude about it. There are many many other hotels in the area. Not even worth it if you're desperate. And the place smells like cat crap (they allow pets) and curry (they are Indian)

Reviews.Title: “Crack Pipe In Room, Theft”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer411
Reviews.Content: the worst! found a crack pipe in the room! plus I think the lady at the front desk stole my credit card info to make fraudulent charges.

Reviews.Title: “Beware This Place is a DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: jetskier426
Reviews.Content: I booked with Hotels.com while waiting to get off a cruise ship.Two hours later we arrived at the "hotel" to find a lot of their windows boarded up with plywood. I went to the "lobby" that had plywood being used for countertops and the office had a full view their living quarters. To say the least the conditions in the lobby made we really question my decision to stay there. I asked to see a room as our room was not ready. She gave me a key and I had to schlock up a lot of stairs as they had no working elevator. A guest had their door wide open and their kids were running all over the place. The father was in a state of undress. The conditions in the hallway were very shabby and smelled. The room I saw was dirty and smelled of "something". I immediatly went back to talk to the manager and told her I wanted my money back. I had reserved for 2 nights. She refused the first night, so I am out $152.66. Beware this place as it should be noted they are running a scam. You are not seeing a picture of the back of the place. Also, the airplanes fly about 200 feet directly over your head, when landing at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Rough and Ready!”
Reviews.Author: tammlynn
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wanted to cancel my reservation, but since they had my credit card number I decided it probably wasn't worth the hassle. It was about an $8 cab ride and ten minute trip from the airport. Nice location downtown, near little Italy. The other positive aspect about the hotel was the bathroom appeared clean. However, do not look too closely at the rest of the room. Unfortunately, I looked under the bed and noticed an extremely thick layer of dust. Also, the pillows are yellowed and stained in places. I had to drag my luggage up the stairs since the elevator was not working. I happened to look out my window in the morning to the view of a bum picking through the garbage about 10 feet from where I was standing. The continental breakfast consists of thinly sliced muffins and breads sitting on a tray near the coffee. The clerk who checked us in was not friendly at all and inflated my agreed upon price (which I clearly understood to include taxes and fees) by about $4. It wasn't worth arguing about since we arrived late in the evening. I would only stay at this place again if I was very desperate for a room in downtown San Diego, otherwise there are plenty of other more comfortable options.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably awful!!”
Reviews.Author: weddingbelles
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where to begin a summary of all of the things that shocked us about this hotel....At check-in, the manager (an older woman) couldn't find our reservation, when we finally got to our room, it was being used as a storage room and was full of what looked like large plastic bags full of ceiling tile...and when we complained she said, "what's the big deal?" The room to which we were finally moved stunk to high heaven, was missing part of the bathroom window, and was highly unclean (flies swarming...). Any Youth Hostel or halfway house is nicer than this hotel -- they really should be reported to some kind of authority.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged us when we arrived, so BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: kimigirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights on the hotel website, just to save any confusion about rates once we got there. On their website here in Australia, it said "Rates in your currency" which obviously meant in Australian dollars. But when we arrived, the owner was in Paris and Lila told us to just pay the quoted amount in US dollars (about $30 more than Australian dollars) and that she would sort it out with the owner upon his return, and send us a refund. Well, after many emails, the owner finally replied twice, but then went silent when it came to agreeing to send us the refund. The hotel itself was OK and well-situated, and we got free internet in the office. I have read quite a few reviews of people having trouble with refunds and getting overcharged, so BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flipperblue82
Reviews.Content: If I could give this hotel a 0/5 I would...It was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. First of all, there were people smoking marijuana in the rooms across the hall from us,and nothing was done about it. There were loud noises and banging in the night all night long,and FINALLY, on the second morning, we woke up to bed bugs in our beds!! Numerous bugs crawling all over the sheets. When we went to management about it, they blew us off and called us liars, doing nothing about it, and not even coming up to the room to leave. We left a night early...without a refund. I would not leave me dog in this hotel for a night, much less advise any human being to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Lost sleep”
Reviews.Author: Lizbeth712
Reviews.Content: We booked this place last minute and boy was that a mistake. I didn't even want to walk around barefoot in the room.....it just felt gross! At night I coudln't sleep because my fellow hotel goers were partying and there was a dog that would not stop barking! The windows are terrible, you can hear everything that happens on the street. Save your money, pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: whitbywitch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely holiday in Arizona. We decided to spend a night at the Harbour View Inn and Suites in San Diego and truly wished we had stayed elsewhere. The rooms are shabby despite reading on the website that the rooms had been recently refurbised (the towel rail must have been removed for refurbishment as only the two side supports remained!) The air was filled with a sweet sickly smell continually so you need to keep the windows as wide open as possible. I would not recommend this hotel. The car parking scheme is a scam, we were told that parking was included in the price but on arrival, despite our protest, we were charged $5. We were informed the free parking was, in fact, in the street wherever we could find a space! The breakfast was the worst I have ever encountered in my life and was as follows....Three muffins cut into thin slices served in a filthy basket on paper plates the manager had wiped on her leg first. We didn't get as far as looking at the coffee, needless to say we wouldn't touch any of it with a bargepole!!! The hotel is in a good location but that's the only positive thing I can say. If you are thinking of staying here ...don't, pay a little more and find somewhere comfortable, clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but needs work”
Reviews.Author: jr1965
Reviews.Content: Rude management. They asked me to change rooms after I had stayed one night. I was planning to stay another night, but decided not to because they offered no explanation or apology for demanding (they did not really ask. They just told me to move to a diffierent room.) that I change rooms. The water pressure is low in the shower. The elevator does not work. Not good if you are on the third floor. Internet access and TV are good. Bed was comfortable. Room was clean. TV has all the channels I like. Overall, not terrible, but the rude management killed the deal for me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - terrible old woman manager”
Reviews.Author: BusTravFarAndWide
Reviews.Content: They've tried to update the rooms, but the water is terrible and the service is terrible - just a reminder always to look at room before you pay because the manager refuses to refund once you pay (and I merely looked at the room and came down). Her son will do whatever she demands, so you're not safe if she's not there either. Rooms, despite being renovated, smell a lot, the water is not clean, and the continental breakfast consists of cut up chocolate donuts. Don't waste a night of your life at this renovated dump.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: dbubbafu
Reviews.Content: After setting up the initial reservations for a four night stay at the Harborview Inn & Suites (due to the deal we received through a website) my friend who was traveling with me searched deeper for reviews. We were saddened to find that most reviews of the hotel were poor, but, seeing as how we couldn't cancel on such short notice, we decided to give it a chance. Upon arrival the lady at the front desk attempted to swindle a parking fee out of us after we had been quoted free parking over the phone. Luckily we had printouts of several websites stating that there were no such charges. After a few moments she decided we would not be swayed and allowed us to park for free. Before departing for our room we had the "pleasure" of seeing a family member walk out in only a pair of boxers and an undershirt. We soon learned that there was no functioning elevator during "construction" and were forced to carry our luggage up the three flights of stairs to our room. The door would not open easily and had to be rammed with a shoulder to create a very narrow opening. This was due to the door being stopped by one of the two queen sized beds which was too close to the door. The room appeared clean and did not smell as I have read in other reviews. The bathroom door would not close and there were holes in the both the door and above the shower. We did not have a coffeemaker in our room as has been stated on many websites for this hotel. There was no wireless internet connection available as well. Airplanes flew loudly overhead. There was no remote for the television. After a few days we realized that the sheets had not been changed and the towels were the the same ones we had been using except they had folded them up and placed them back on the rack. I could go on, but I won't due to lack of time but I will say that I would never choose this hotel again and advise anyone who does to do so with caution. The owners/managers who live in an apartment adjacent to the front desk on the bottom floor do not seem as though they have any morals in regards to what they choose to charge you for.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for you”
Reviews.Author: hurricanelarry
Reviews.Content: Well... where do I start... I was traveling in SD and have been for many months. On this trip my admin did not book my hotel and I had no room for three nights, so I called my travel agent AMEX and after checking 100 hotels in the area oddly enough this one had a room, but they wanted a 5 night booking at 189.95 per night, and/or for 1 night 289.95. So I drove down to The Hotel which at the time the name â€œHarbor View Inn and Suitesâ€� sounded dreamy, and was absolutely livid when I saw the place, and even more livid when I saw the room. It looked like a Hotel from the 1940's the floor was four inches off from one side of the room to the other, the TV was leaning hard and on the down side of the leaning floor or it would have fallen from itâ€™s TV stand and crushed me, the walls had more coats of paint then Tammy Fae's make up, the windows, single pain glass paper thin and, the bed hard as a rock and just as lumpy, the towels very worn out and non absorbent, and they had no tooth paste or tooth brushes to hand out to the desk. And then at about 2 AM in the morning after just barely falling out from the loud traffic outside my balcony, the planes started flying in, every 5 minutes. Need I say more? So the morning came for the desk clerk at about 5 AM and it was me ringing the bell wanting to check the Hell out of Dodge. After about 10 minutes of solid bell ringing the Bed headed, not well rested attendant finally come to the door to collect the room key from my tired and pissed off hand, and I bid him a New York farewell and recommend to anyone and everyone, NEVER to stay at this Hotel unless you can sleep through anything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management cheated me!! This needs to be reported!!”
Reviews.Author: Salu
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, it looks like there is some kind of a scam running with this hotel!! At the time of checking in, they seem to claim that their reservation is cancelled and then they make an extra buck out of you by saying they are providing a fridge or microwave or balcony!! Looks like they are cheating cusotmers on one pretext or the other. Please do not stay here.. it will be cheaper to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Crooked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I called to ask the rate on a particular date and was quited $89. Based on that I booked the room for one night. I asked them for an email confirmation and was told they don't do that (!). But they gave me a confirmation number. I called back a couple days later in hopes that I would get someone else who could give me an email confirmation. I did get someone else, but again was told they do not do email confirmations. Nevertheless I gave him my confirmation number and THIS TIME I was told the rate is $99. When I eventually arrived and checked into the hotel, they ran the credit card and the charge looked a little high so I asked them for a breakdown of the charges and was told the base price (before taxes, etc) was $109!!! Seems the price goes up $10 for each time I ask. The woman was polite and all, but I stresses that THIS is why I sought an email confirmation. She simply stated that there were no rates as low as what I was telling her, but I could only repeat that it was based on what I was told in the very conversation when I booked the room. I guess I should have recorded every conversation I had with them, but they'd probably just tell me it was someone else. Still a cheap rate for an extremely, um, rustic hotel with no amenities, but I'd rather pay twice the amount for a place that doesn't repeatedly lie to me.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for budget”
Reviews.Author: dikthompson
Reviews.Content: Very safe area to stay in, other reviewers are a little snobby complaining about silly little things. True it is slapped together not your typical box room which I hate anyways. Also true its not for everyone, always know where you are staying before you book a hotel, very stupid to book without knowing anything about your hotel. EVERYTHING is free with your room rate unlike more expensive hotels. Good tv, close to highways. I paid $53 a night and stayed 1 week. Glad I didnt pay for those snobby Hyatt overpriced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Harborview Inn and Suites is located ~2.5 miles from the airport ($10 cab ride) and about a block from Little Italy (great restraunts). There are a few parking spots on the street. (except Thursday morning when the street is cleaned) That just about sums up the good. When I showed up I learned that my reservation was "not confirmed" even though my card was charged the 10% late arrival deposit. They did still have a room available for only $20 more than they had originally purchased. They refused to return the 10% deposit saying that it had been pulled from the booking agency. After returning home I learned that it was the hotel that had charged the 10%. Since it is only ~10 I didn't pursue it further. However buyer beware! The hotel exterior looks decent and maintained. Once you get inside however, you see and smell the age. The hallways and rooms could have come from the 50's. (the elevator too, I only dared take the stairs) It all made me think I was back in Russia. (that is not meant to be a compliment) The kitchen area is purely cosmetic and completely wasted. The hotel could wall it off completely and no one would be the worse. The kitchen window was covered with blinds that let in a lot of light from the streets at night. The beds didn't have fitted sheets. The bottom sheet was too short and stained. From the stains I know that the bedding is not changed between nights. The bathroom has a step up toilet and blind windows. (the glass themselves are like horizontal blinds, my first time seeing this kind of window) The soap and shampoo were very cheap and the mirror was an old rusting medicine cabinet. The hotel is close to the airport and directly under one of the flight paths. Planes can be heard landing until ~10pm and again in the morning ~6am. The traffic outside can also be heard all night long. Fortunately I am a sound sleeper so the light and noise didn't keep me awake. The first morning after inquiring about the advertised continental breakfast, the gentleman brought out a couple of thinly sliced muffins and some coffee. I ended up going to Little Italy for something more. I would definitely not recommend this place to any of my friends or even enemies. If you want a low cost place to stay, try anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel" From Hell!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was filthy in the rooms and halls. The room smelled of sweat, cigarette smoke, dust and mold. The fan, 2 lights and A/C didn't work. There were holes drilled all the way through the door. People hung around the halls all night, drinking, smoking and talking loudly. There is NO view, and very loud airplanes kept me awake 18 hours a day. I advise that this place be condemned. It is scary and filthy!

Reviews.Title: “shut this one down.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and had to cancel the other two nights because my plans changed. I knew the policy rules and was prepared to lose the remaining money I spent on the reservation...no problem. I went to the lobby and spoke directly with the main manager just as I did upon arrival, and instead of a queen he offered me a king sized bed at no extra cost. I told him I had to leave early, I apologized and handed him the hotel swipe card. He mentioned that when EXPEDIA called he would let them know we talked and he agreed to give a refund. When I returned home and called to see if the matter was cleared, I was told the manager was not around, he was in conference calls, or he was dealing with other customers. This went on for 3 days. Finally I gave it one last try. When I called I was told that the manager told EXPEDIA that I didn't turn in my key, left without telling them and he couldn't rent out the room to other guests. All that was needed was to say he didn't want to give the refund, where did all the anger come from?

Reviews.Title: “So bad, we checked out before checking in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking this place over a month in advance (and not bothering to read reviews before hand, my bad), I arrived with my girlfriend, knowing the place had some bad reviews (i found this website the night before our trip). My girlfriend asked the nice Eastern lady at the desk to see a room before we checked in. We got the key for one that had an outside entrance (not safe), the toilet wasn't working, there was standing water in the bottom of the refrigerator and it smelled of mold. So back to the front desk to ask for a refund. The lady was very cooperative (I think this happens a lot) and promised not to bill us and called the parent company. I talked with the guy for a few minutes, answered the usual questions (what's wrong with the room) and was told they'd notify me within 5 days if I was getting a refund or not. I was shocked that upon return from my vacation, about 5 days later, I got an email confirming my refund (I confirmed that with my credit card company). So, I got my money back and hope everyone spends a bit more money and go one block to the Super 8. Not fancy, but much cleaner and safer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Far Away From This One”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other reviewers that this place was filthy, smelly, and moldy, but beware also of scams at this horrid place. We stayed here prior to a cruise and had reservations here when we returned. We arrived early after the cruise and were told our room was not ready but they would keep the luggage and put it in the room for us. That evening when we returned to the hotel I was told that I had not prepaid Hotels.com for the room. When I showed them the receipt they gave us the key to the room but called Hotels.com. Hotels.com phoned us several times during that night, telling us first that I had cancelled the reservation earlier in the week. This was not true. Then the front desk called wanting us to leave $20.00 on the dresser when we left, supposedly to pay for a balcony attached to the room -- if that is what one could possibly call it. Finally Hotels determined that the hotel planned to charge us $199 that night instead of the prepaid rate of $90, and of course, the hotel had been the one to cancel the reservation. I want to commend Hotels.com for working for two days on our behalf to force the hotel to only charge the $90.00. Bottom line--if you value your health and pocketbook, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never under any circumstances stay in this hotel. We had booked a room prior to going on a cruise and a room there when we returned. I agree with the other reviewers' comments about the filthy unsafe condition of this place. But, also be careful of financial scams. We were unable to change to another hotel when we returned from the cruise because of a convention in the city. When we arrived at the hotel we were told we had not prepaid for the room, which was untrue. I produced a receipt, and we were given a filthy room. I then received a phone call from Hotels stating that I had cancelled the room earlier in the week, which also was not true. After a number of calls from Hotels, we concluded that the hotel had cancelled the reservation and was probably going to charge a higher rate than I had prepaid. Sure enough, the $90.00 room was now $120.00. Plus the front desk called and told me to leave $20.00 in the room, because it had a balcony, if indeed that is what one would call it. I do want to commend Hotels for working on my behalf and forcing the hotel to charge only the agreed upon/prepaid rate. We did not leave the $20.00 on the dresser! Stay away from here if you value your health and your pocketbook.

HotelInfo.Name: Harborview Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 550 W Grape St, San Diego, CA 92101
